duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and demonstrate commitment to the company’s safety culture, ensuring an injury-free environment through individual actions and mentoring.
Manage subcontractors and oversee the organization of the overall job and workflow, including staff, subcontractors, suppliers, and programs such as Safety, Quality, and EEOC.
Develop work plans for subcontractors and self-performed work, and manage the care, custody, and control of the project site.
Lead various meetings, attend essential progress and project meetings, and implement and manage the project’s schedule as needed.
Track and monitor project budget and costs, communicate key project information to stakeholders, and ensure compliance with project filing and documentation.
Manage material and equipment needs for the project, support procurement and approval processes, and assist in selecting tools and equipment necessary for self-perform operations.
Participate in project review meetings, negotiation processes, and project buyout meetings with stakeholders and subcontractors.
Identify and recruit top talent, promote a culture of diversity and inclusion, and understand and apply non-discrimination policies throughout the organization.
Manage the largest, most complex stand-alone and/or multiple complex projects from initial planning to completion, providing management and/or oversight to multiple projects and project teams.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in construction management, engineering or related field (Preferred)
